alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:20PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Apache County through 700 PM MDT... At 619 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pine Springs, or 33 miles west of Gallup, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds of up to 45 mph, heavy rain, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 347 and 359. State Route 264 between mile markers 449 and 466. Highway 191 between mile markers 386 and 408. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may also result in roads becoming muddy and impassable!

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
